posts.post_content:
This thing reminds me a bit of [Cursed Scroll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cursed Scroll). Except instead of hitting your own hand, you look at an opponent's. And instead of naming a card, you name a colour and a number.
  
   
And instead of being really good, it is not.
  
   
Don't try to break this card either - you'll only end up with seven years' bad luck to show for it.
posts.html:

And instead of being really good, it is not.

Don't try to break this card either - you'll only end up with seven years' bad luck to show for it.

Posted By: LeMaK (12/12/2009 5:37:54 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This is bad, but it's not as bad as its community rating suggests. In subsequent turns you get to see your opponent's hand, so you really only have to account for guessing what their draw is. So it's basically an expensive [Telepathy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Telepathy) that also draws you cards mostly every turn. Should you play it? *Heck* no. Would it be a total waste if you did? Not entirely.
